text: Off the top of my head, I can’t think of a way to do this natively in HubSpot. It would be a very quick API job. Probably even something you could do in a few mins with Zapier.

Hey all. I'm actually a designer and I've been trying to get some answers around the limitations of HubSpot (if any) from a Design point of view. Hopefully you could help with some of my questions.

• Can I still use sound/music in the background
• Can I edit the cursors to be custom in different sections?
• If I wanted the cursor to "reveal" a background image as it moves over it, is that doable.
Apologies if these are things that are not hindered by HubSpot.

Thanks in advance.

sky’s the limit with all of these. I would never set sound/music in the background, though. I have never met a single user who wants that. If you do, then have a clearly visible “mute sound” button that sets a cookie to save that mute preference for later.
hello, do you know why my JS elements are still working in AMP mode?

this can actually be a handful of issues. There is a character limit on URL length - so some of them could be too long and that will just kill it all without any error log. If you contact HubSpot support they will likely be able to sort through the issue a bit better for you when there is no actual error displayed. They are usually pretty timely on it as well.

Is anyone aware of a way to convert a LOCAL custom module into a GLOBAL custom module which is inside of a theme?  I know this is possible using the CLI tools.  Anything front-facing for HubSpot customers?  I get asked this a ton!  I would expect an option to be here.
<@U38EZFVFE> A way not involving the CLI. Gotcha.
the old DM used  to allow that
Does anyone know how to remove the skip from the HubSpot video
css or is it in an iframe?

basically I want to force someone to fill out the form before they watch the video
